title: Sejuani's "Stay in the Fight" Buffs
body:
So I play Sejuani a fair amount, and I can't say I'm overly thrilled by the new changes.  Riot said that the changes were in order to give her incentive to stay in the fight, but her W already provided that incentive, since it was a large part of her damage and it was a 4 second DoT.  What's more, with 40% CDR, you could actually cast your W pretty much as soon as the DoT finished.  Combined with an Iceborn and a Sunfire, you were dealing some serious sustained damage.

It looks like Riot was trying to switch a lot of Sej's sustained damage to permafrost, which would be great if there wasn't the delay on reapplying frost.  As it stands, though, Having a 3.6 second CD on won't do you much good.

Permafrost has a 1.5 second duration and then targets have immunity to frost for 3 seconds.  That means 4.5 seconds minimum.  Probably more like 5 or 6 when you figure in having to actually reapply frost and then cast permafrost.  So unless Riot is trying to tell a tank not to build CDR, that doesn't make much sense.  And they nerfed the slow duration, so really a net nerf on her CC in fights.  With old Sej's 2.5 second slow, the CD with max CDR was 6.6 seconds, which worked out nicely with the frost reapplication CD and provided a strong CC presence.

Riot, any explanation on these changes?  I'm failing to see the buffs here... am I missing something?

I couldn't follow your post, but from he link you sent me it's easy to see that you can do more damage with W while missing two ticks of of the aoe damage. Some things to keep in mind.

* we are going to assume level 9 so you have the ability maxed
* we are going to assume you have at least juggernaut and giant belt because you should have about that much at level 9.
* you have 0 ap because you are tanking
* we are ignoring magic resist

I saw that you said maxing Q is better for farming so i'll show you why it's not. 

* I'd say the average health of the big minion at each camp is around 1800 health. 
* The base damage of arctic assault is 160 at level 5 with doing 12% of targets maximum health. 
* 12% of 1800 is 216 + 160 base damage is **376**. 

* When you max flail first you are doing a base damage of 120 when you hit the target as well as an additional 60 + 2.5% bonus health (22) per tick with a total of 4 ticks. 
* Jungle creeps aren't going to run away from you so you will hit all 4 ticks 
* The total damage you are going to do is 120+4(82)=**448** 
* So according to "math" maxing flail is better then maxing arctic assault. 
* The cooldown and mana cost of flail are MUCH lower than that of arctic assault

Your next point was that maxing permafrost does more damage than maxing flail. 

* Permafrost does 260 damage. 
* The full damage that W does is shown above, 448 damage. Much more than that of permafrost. 
* lets say you miss 2 ticks of flail, you are still doing 284 damage.

---

Keep in mind before you say something like you can't stay in range for her flail to be useful, 

* her ultimate is a 1.25 second stun and there is an additional .75 second slow. 
* Arctic assault knocks you in the air for about 1 second.
* permafrost slows you for about 1.5 seconds.
* That totals 4.5 seconds of crowd control to land an auto attack and ticks of the flail. 
* Again, you can miss 2 ticks of flail to do more damage than permafrost.

she's not hard to learn, skills are pretty easy to understand.
skill order should probably be W > E > Q > R since W will now legitimately add more damage than the other abilities and you won't get such huge bonuses to the utility of E that would justify leveling it first before the last patch.
marks probably should be AS, not because of her passive so much as nothing else will really help your jungle clear as much as more autos, even if you mostly deal magic damage for most of the game. seals could be flat hp or flat armor, armor will help survive the jungle better i believe, but hp also isn't bad and will give you a tiny bit of damage on your w, runes should be flat MR or scaling MR, depending on if you want to gank early or not (sejuani has some of the best pre-6 ganks in the game, and once she gets her ult they're even better) quints can be ms, hp, or even ap as her ratios are still pretty strong
masteries definitely should go deepest into defense, her hp ratio on W doesn't look too bad when it's maxed, and the heavy cc on her kit encourages her to want to be able to get into position to lock down enemy carries and then keep them from escaping.
i do think she's fun, i like cc heavy tanks that can lead their team to victory

she's kinda like an amumu with more cc and mobility at the cost of damage. your ult is crazy powerful but remember that an ult that hits is worth MUCH more than an ult that misses and only gets the slow, so if you can it's good to fire it at point blank range to guarantee a stun on two or more enemies, your Q can be used to dash to an ally and peel an assassin off them, or charge into a fight and start scaring off a carry. then when your team gets an edge in a fight your permafrost will keep the stragglers from escaping and you can easily secure an ace for your team. sejuani can fall behind all game but still win with a really good performance in one late game teamfight.
